ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Greatly improved my speaking, writing, and reading ability in Spanish. Also learned a lot about the culture and economies of different Spanish speaking countries.
During this class, I learned several new verb tenses and continued to expand my Spanish vocabulary.
Lots of grammar and vocab. Also my writing definitely got better.
I learned how to become conversational in Spanish and was able to learn more vocabularly.
Better vocabulary and grammar in Spanish

I feel like my knowledge and Spanish ability grew a lot this semester! We went beyond the basics, and I learned so much from the preterite to the subjunctive to culture in Spanish speaking countries. I also learned how to balance daily homework assignments (something I became a lot better with this semester), and how to study throughout the semester instead of just the day before a test.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The homework was often busywork, but the classes were engaging and I learned a ton. I loved our culture project at the end of the year, where we did a deep dive into a theme in a Spanish speaking country.

I thought that we did not spend enough time in class discussing the new verb tenses we learned and practicing how to use them in a structured way. Over the course of the semester, I felt like I got lost in verb soup, where all of the different endings got mixed up in my head, and there wasn't any real opportunity to work past this confusion in the classroom, or in the homework. I did really appreciate the asynchronous day.
It was pretty straightforward but also not super engaging stylistically  and lots of learning has to be done on your own and it moves fast
I think the course moves too fast and requires too much work outside of the class considering it already meets for 5 hours a week.

It was a lot of work!! I felt the jump from Spanish I to II to be completely overwhelming at times. I spent 2 to 3 hours on homework most nights, and found the weekly projects/activities to be a lot. If I had a more rigorous course load the past semester I probably would have felt completely lost, but was lucky I could spend the time that was needed most nights to complete all assignments to the best of my ability. But it was a lot. I feel like it is tricky because there are so many students who do have much greater experience, and so I often feel self-conscious, especially with presentations, even if I put in a lot of work preparing and practicing. A strength I think was learning about the culture and systems of different countries, which we did less of last semester, so I really appreciated that! I really enjoyed looking at art too, and learning about, for example, the health systems of different countries. I also really enjoyed doing the cultural project and the play. Overall, I think it is a good course, and I learned a lot, but wish the work load was a little more manageable and there was more understanding of the different places everyone was coming in from.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes- decent amount of work, but great if you want to improve your Spanish.
This class was definitely a grind, but I did ultimately feel like my Spanish continued to improve.
If they want to take Spanish then sure
I would recommend this course to another student who is wanting to get better at having conversations in Spanish
Yes. Its an enjoyable class if you enjoy learning a new language
I would recommend for any student interested in learning Spanish (they will definitely learn a lot!!), although with the warning that it has a difficult work load.
